newsitem.title: NIGERIA: Nigerian oil firm gets foreign partner.
newsitem.headline: Nigerian oil firm gets foreign partner.

text.p: An indigenous oil company has secured a deal to operate jointly with an American firm in Nigeria's upstream sector, the semi-official Daily Times newspaper reported on Tuesday.

It said Peak Petroleum Nigeria Limited and NTI Resources planned to invest over $29 million in the venture, adding that NTI would fund the drilling of two wells under Peak Petroleum's oil prospecting licence (OPL) at a cost of $14.8 million each.
NTI, as operator of the venture, has a 40 percent equity in the deal while the Nigerian company holds the rest.
Officials of the companies were unavailable to comment on the report.

Nigeria's military government has granted 20 indigenous firms OPLs in order to promote local participation in the upstream sector. Some of them are already operating in partnership with foreign oil companies.
